parts.description: Factory exhaust system. Quiet and restrictive.
Bolt-on cat-back with a throaty rumble. The first step.
Full mandrel-bent stainless system. Sounds serious.
High-flow catalytic converter with free-flowing cat-back. Legal-ish.
No cats, no muffler, no mercy. Extremely loud. Cops will notice.
Full titanium system. Burns blue at the tips. Featherlight.
Equal-length headers mated to a full race exhaust. Maximum flow.
A one-off exhaust that screams like a banshee. Legend says the welder who built it went deaf and didn't care.
Factory airbox. Designed for noise reduction, not performance.
Draws cool air from below the bumper. Nice induction sound.
Shorter path means faster throttle response. Gets heat-soaked easily.
Trumpet-shaped stacks that smooth airflow into each runner. Loud and proud.
Smooth carbon fiber plenum with insulated runners. Heat stays out.
CNC-ported intake manifold matched to the head. Massive high-RPM gains.
One throttle body per cylinder. Requires standalone ECU to tune. The sound alone is worth it.
An intake so perfectly tuned it seems to breathe on its own. Built by an old man in Yokohama who speaks to engines.
No forced induction. Pure NA response.
Quick-spooling small turbo. Modest boost, minimal lag.
Good balance of spool and top-end power. The daily-driveable boost.
Big turbo, big power, big lag. Full boost hits like a freight train.
Split exhaust scroll for faster spool. Best of both worlds.
Instant boost, no lag. That classic whine. Heavy but effective.
Belt-driven centrifugal. Linear power delivery, great top-end.
Two turbos, sequential operation. Small turbo for low-end, big turbo for top. Incredible power.
Turbo stays spooled between shifts. Flames shoot from the exhaust. Rally-spec insanity.
Zero's personal turbo setup. Nobody knows exactly how it works. The boost gauge reads numbers that shouldn't exist.
Factory suspension. Comfort over performance.
Drop the ride height, tighten the feel. The gateway mod.
Adjustable height and damping. Dial in your setup.
32-way adjustable. Compression, rebound, camber plates. For the obsessive tuner.
Motorsport-derived. Remote reservoirs, pillowball mounts. Stiff but precise.
Adjustable ride height at the touch of a button. Show stance to race height in seconds.
Electronically controlled dampers that adapt in real-time. Comfort and grip on demand.
Diesel's personal suspension recipe. The car floats over imperfections yet sticks to the road like glue. He won't tell anyone the spring rates.
Factory brakes. Adequate for daily driving.
High-friction compound pads. Better bite, more dust.
Slotted rotors clear gas and dust. Consistent pedal feel under heat.
Cross-drilled and slotted. Maximum heat dissipation. Look great behind the wheel spokes.
Massive multi-piston calipers with oversized rotors. Stops on a dime.
Supercar-grade carbon ceramic rotors. Fade-proof, lightweight. Worth more than some cars.
Brakes so aggressive they feel like hitting a wall. Prototype aerospace compound. Your passengers will complain.
Factory all-season tires. Jack of all trades, master of none.
Summer performance tires. Noticeably more grip than stock.
R-compound tires. Minimal tread, maximum grip. Useless in the rain.
No tread at all. Track-only compound. Insane grip on dry pavement.
Deep-grooved wet-weather tires. Essential for Nova Pacifica's rain seasons.
Hard compound rears for controlled slides. The drift tax is real.
Super-soft compound drag radials. Incredible launch grip, terrible everywhere else.
Prototype compound that defies physics. They call them magnets because the car sticks to the road like it's glued there.
Factory gearbox. Smooth shifts, long ratios.
Shorter shift throws for faster gear changes. Feels mechanical and precise.
Tighter gear ratios keep the engine in the powerband. Less drop between shifts.
Push-pull sequential shifting. Lightning-fast gear changes. Brutal engagement.
No synchros. Dog rings slam into gear. Violent, fast, and not for the faint-hearted.
Pre-selects the next gear. Shifts in milliseconds. The future of speed.
Shifts so fast you can't feel them. Rumored to have been pulled from a prototype that was never meant to exist.
Factory ECU with conservative maps. Leaves power on the table.
Piggyback module that intercepts sensor signals. Quick gains, no risk.
Full standalone engine management. Every parameter tunable. Requires dyno time.
Standalone ECU with integrated launch control. Holds RPM, dumps the clutch, gone.
Advanced traction control with adjustable slip thresholds. Keeps power down in corners.
Full telemetry and data logging. Learn from every run, optimize everything.
Keeps the turbo spooled between shifts by retarding ignition. Pops and bangs. Hard on parts.
AI-assisted ECU that learns your driving style and adapts in real-time. It thinks faster than you do.
No nitrous oxide system installed.
Small wet shot system. Adds fuel with the nitrous for safety. A little extra push.
Medium wet shot. Solid hit of power on demand. Don't hold it too long.
Big wet shot. Serious power. Engine internals better be up to it.
Dry shot relies on ECU for fuel. Massive hit. Engine must be fully built or it's a grenade.
A nitrous system with a mysterious blue bottle that seems to refill faster than it should. Nobody asks where it comes from.
Factory cast pistons and rods. Fine for stock power levels.
Forged aluminum pistons. Stronger, lighter, ready for boost.
H-beam forged rods. Won't bend under pressure. Essential for high-boost builds.
CNC-ported and polished head. Flows air like nothing factory ever could.
Aggressive cam profiles. Wild idle, massive top-end. The engine sounds alive.
Increased displacement via longer stroke crankshaft. More cubes, more torque.
Forged pistons, rods, balanced crank, ARP studs. The foundation for serious power.
Ported head, race cams, valve springs, titanium retainers. Breathes deep and revs high.
Complete engine teardown and rebuild. Every component upgraded, balanced, and blueprinted. A work of art.
Hand-built by a master engine builder who spent 300 hours on it. Each component selected by hand. It doesn't just run â€” it sings.
Factory open diff. Power goes to the wheel with least resistance.
Clutch-type LSD. Both wheels get power. Essential for any serious build.
Helical gear LSD. Smooth, progressive lockup. Great all-around.
Both wheels locked together. Terrible for daily driving. Perfect for drifting.
Chromoly flywheel. Engine revs faster. Clutch engagement is more abrupt.
A differential so perfectly geared it feels like the wheels read your mind. Mechanical telepathy.
Full factory body and interior. Comfortable but heavy.
Remove the spare, back seats, sound deadening. Every kilogram counts.
Lightweight carbon hood with optional vents. Looks fast, is fast.
Carbon fiber fenders, doors, trunk. Serious weight savings across the whole body.
Every body panel replaced with carbon fiber. Roll cage integrated. Pure race car.
Aerospace-grade composites that shouldn't exist on a street car. The car weighs almost nothing. It moves like it's defying gravity.
Factory radiator and fans. Adequate for stock power.
Full aluminum radiator with better flow. Keeps temps in check under load.
Large front-mount intercooler for forced induction setups. Cooler charge air means more power.
External oil cooler with thermostat. Keeps oil temps stable during hard driving.
Oversized radiator, oil cooler, transmission cooler, brake ducts. Everything stays cool under maximum attack.
Factory body shape. Designed for looks, not downforce.
Simple front lip that reduces lift. Subtle but effective at speed.
Rear lip spoiler for added rear downforce. Slight drag penalty.
Tall adjustable GT wing. Serious downforce, serious drag. Makes a statement.
Large front splitter with endplates. Manages airflow under the car.
Complete aero package: splitter, side skirts, diffuser, wing. Wind tunnel tested.
Electronically controlled aero surfaces that adjust based on speed. Low drag on straights, maximum downforce in corners.
Factory halogen headlights. They work.
Bright blue-white HID projectors. Better visibility, better style.
Modern LED conversion with DRL strips. Clean and bright.
LED underglow in your choice of color. Peak 2000s street culture.
Interior accent lighting. Footwell and dash glow. Sets the mood.
Aftermarket gauges: boost, oil temp, oil pressure, EGT. Information is power.
Factory organic clutch. Easy engagement, limited torque capacity.
Upgraded organic clutch with stiffer pressure plate. Good for mild builds.
Kevlar clutch disc with upgraded pressure plate. Handles boosted applications.
6-puck sprung clutch. Aggressive engagement, extreme holding power.
Dual disc setup for massive torque capacity. Grabby pedal, unbreakable hold.
Factory anti-roll bars. Soft and comfortable.
Thicker hollow bars reduce body roll in corners. Tighter turn-in.
Three-way adjustable stiffness. Tune understeer and oversteer balance.
Solid race-spec bars with spherical bearings. Minimal flex, maximum control.
No chassis bracing installed.
Connects the front strut towers to reduce chassis flex. Sharper steering response.
Rear strut bar prevents the rear end from flexing under load.
Front and rear strut bars with lower arm braces. Serious chassis stiffening.
Welded chromoly roll cage ties the whole chassis together. Track-only stiff.
Classic NOS 50hp shot. Quick spool killer, drag strip secret weapon.
75hp hit of nitrous. Enough to gap most opponents. Don't go full throttle too long.
100hp shot. Violent acceleration. Stock internals need not apply.
150hp monster shot. Fully built engine mandatory. This is race fuel territory.
Entry-level supercharger. Instant power, classic whine. No lag whatsoever.
Higher boost supercharger with upgraded pulleys. Screaming power delivery.
Full-bore race supercharger. Instant tire-shredding torque everywhere.
Basic bolt-on turbo kit. Quick spool, modest gains. Gateway to boost.
Mid-sized turbo with upgraded internals. Strong midrange punch.
Big power turbo. Some lag but huge payoff when spooled.
Maximum effort single turbo. Four-digit horsepower capable. Build everything first.
Basic reflash of factory ECU. Safe gains with no hardware.
Custom map for bolt-ons. Takes full advantage of intake and exhaust.
Aggressive tune for forced induction setups. Runs on 93 octane minimum.
Full race calibration. E85 or race gas required. Extracts every last pony.
Mild performance cams. Slightly lumpy idle, nice top-end power.
Aggressive street cams. Power shifts higher in the RPM band.
Radical race cams. Rough idle, screaming high-end power. Valve float is your enemy.
Increased compression ratio for NA builds. Needs premium fuel. More squeeze, more power.
Valve job and basic port cleanup. Smooth airflow for modest gains.
Hand-ported and mirror-polished intake and exhaust ports. The air just glides through.
CNC-machined ports to perfect tolerances. Maximum flow, maximum power.
High-flow drop-in filter. Simple upgrade, noticeable sound.
Remove the catalytic converters for maximum flow. Very illegal. Very effective.
No mufflers, just straight pipes. Deafeningly loud. Track use only.
Drift-tuned coilovers with aggressive rear settings. Slide for days.
Competition drift suspension. Predictable slides, infinite angle capability.
Race-compound pads. Need heat to work properly. Insane bite when hot.
Upgraded 4-piston front calipers with larger rotors. Better bite and fade resistance.
6-piston front and 4-piston rear with two-piece rotors. Serious stopping power.
Monobloc calipers with massive rotors. Stops like it hit a wall. Track-ready.
Tighter gear spacing keeps engine in the powerband. Quick acceleration.
Full race gearbox with straight-cut gears. Whines like a race car. Shifts instantly.
